title: Lips Contour Detection and Tracking Using Watershed Region-Based Active Contour Model and Modified <formula formulatype="inline"><tex Notation="TeX">$H_{\infty}$</tex></formula>
publicationTitle: IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems for Video Technology
abstract: In this paper, a region-based active contour model (ACM) with local information using watershed segmentation is proposed for lips contour detection. Compared to the ACM with global energy terms, the proposed system provides a more precise lips contour convergence under the circumstances where the lips are difficult to distinguish using global statistics. Furthermore, since the ACM is sensitive to the initial contour position, a modified H∞ based on Lyapunov stability theory is proposed to provide better tracking of the subsequent lips feature points as the ACM initialization. The integration of the proposed ACM and modified H∞ has revealed an improvement of the overall lips contour detection.

authors.name: Siew Wen Chin
authors.affiliation: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Selangor, Malaysia

p: Siew Wen Chin received the Bachelors and M. Sc. degrees from the University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Jalan Broga, Semenyih, Selangor, Malaysia, in 2006 and 2008, respectively. She is currently pursuing the Ph.D. degree with the University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus.
Her current research interests include image and vision processing, multibiometrics, and signal processing.

authors.name: Kah Phooi Seng
authors.affiliation: School of Computer Technology, Sunway University Malaysia, Selangor, Malaysia

p: Kah Phooi Seng received the B. Eng. (first class) and Ph.D. degrees from the University of Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia, in 1997 and 2001, respectively.

She is currently a Professor with the School of Computer Technology, Sunway University, Bandar Sunway, Selangor, Malaysia. Before joining Sunway University, she was an Associate Professor with the Faculty of Engineering, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Jalan Broga, Semenyih, Selangor. Her current research interests include the fields of intelligent visual processing, multibiometrics, artificial intelligence, and signal processing.

authors.name: Li-Minn Ang
authors.affiliation: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Selangor, Malaysia

p: Li-Minn Ang received the B. Eng. (first class) and Ph.D. degrees from Edith Cowan University, Perth, Australia, in 1996 and 2001, respectively.

He is currently an Associate Professor with the Faculty of Engineering, University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus, Jalan Broga, Semenyih, Selangor, Malaysia. Before joining the Nottingham Malaysia Campus in 2004, he was with the Monash University Malaysia Campus, Bandar Sunway, Selangor. His current research interests include the fields of visual information engineering, wireless sensor networks, and embedded systems.
